image.altText: A man and woman stand crossed arms in front of a road intersection

props.synopsis: Two years ago this intersection claimed the lives of five people in one of Victoria's deadliest crashes. Residents say not enough is being done to prevent the next tragedy.

title.children: Concerns remain over country intersection where crash claimed five lives

image.altText: A white police car turns in front of a well-lit brown building at night on a deserted city street.

props.synopsis: The state opposition says it's obtained documents showing Melbourne's first COVID curfew was announced without proper health advice.

title.children: FOI reveals idea for a Melb COVID curfew did not come from health experts

image.altText: Mitch Owens celebrates a goal for St Kilda.

props.synopsis: Skipper Marcus Bontempelli makes his first appearance of the season for the Western Bulldogs as they take on St Kilda. Follow live.

title.children: Saints threatening to spoil Bontempelli's Bulldogs return

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Swans respond to Aliir Aliir incident
Ollie Wines subbed off with heart issue

image.altText: A young girl with her brown hair in a pony tail in a pink jumper holds her hands under her chin as she gazes at a keyboard.

props.synopsis: Parents and researchers hope the discovery of a genetic mutation could help find treatments for children living with previously undiagnosed neurodevelopmental disorders.

title.children: Discovery of genetic mutation leads to first diagnosis for dozens of kids

image.altText: Police officers stand on the footpath of a city street which is blocked by police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Homicide Squad detectives are investigating the death of a man in Melbourne's inner south-east this morning, along with an unrelated serious assault of a woman in the coastal town of Barwon Heads.

title.children: Man fatally stabbed in Melbourne's popular Chapel Street nightclub strip

image.altText: Zali Steggall speaks in front of journalists at a press conference in a park.

props.synopsis: Voters in traditionally safe seats are pinning their hopes on independent and non-major party candidates, but it takes more than just dreams to flip these electorates.

title.children: How a safe seat gets flipped by a disruptor

image.altText: A young man gestures while speaking and sitting on the couch

props.synopsis: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

title.children: 'Enormously betrayed': Gaza pain mobilises Australian Muslim voters

image.altText: black and white photo of a woman with dark hair in a pale shirt, vest and beads with elbow on table resting head on knuckles

props.synopsis: In 1972 an Australian woman could not even open a bank account without the backing of a man. This is the inside story of how a group of feminists forced political change.

title.children: Meet the woman who turned female votes into political dynamite

image.altText: A man smiles widely as he stands in front of a large wooden cross on a grassy hill with the sun rising in the background

props.synopsis: The faithful have gathered throughout Australia to mark one of the holiest days on the Christian calendar.

title.children: Australian Christians celebrate Easter Sunday across the nation

image.altText: A dark haired woman holds a boy and stares out of an ambulance as a paramedic and policeman talk to her.

props.synopsis: A six-year-old boy who wandered away from family in the Dandenong Ranges has been found by a local mountain-bike rider.

title.children: Olinda boy found unharmed after spending the night missing in bushland in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Damien Hardwick wearing a red Suns polo

props.synopsis: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick does not believe Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan should have commented on whether Richmond's Noah Balta should have been allowed to play while facing sentencing for assault.

title.children: 'Absolute mockery': Hardwick takes aim at Victorian premier over Balta comments

image.altText: Gout Gout waves with his left hand after winning his Stawell gift heat.

props.synopsis: Rising sprint stars Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy comfortably qualify for the Stawell Gift semifinals to be held on Easter Monday.

title.children: Gout and Kennedy storm into Stawell Gift semis

image.altText: Tameka Yallop playing for the Roar against the Victory.

props.synopsis: Matildas midfielder Tameka Yallop suffers a hamstring injury as the Brisbane Roar lose 2-0 to Melbourne Victory in their final match of the A-League Women season.

title.children: Hamstrung Yallop adds to Matildas' injury woes

image.altText: Three wasps nibbling on a piece of bacon.

props.synopsis: European wasps are swarming regional Victoria, forcing businesses to close and residents to stay indoors, as unusually warm weather causes their numbers to spike.

title.children: Cafes shut, children hide indoors as European wasps terrorise Victoria

image.altText: Two people in yellow high vis jackets stand at a bushy beach look out and look towards the sea.

props.synopsis: A sea search is continuing near Phillip Island, south-east of Melbourne, for a man still missing after his wife drowned and another woman was rescued.

title.children: Search resumes for man swept out to sea in Good Friday tragedy in Victoria

image.altText: Planks of processed timber stacked on metal shelves for in a giant hardware store.

props.synopsis: Do you know where the timber in your local hardware store comes from? The

title.children: Opposition vows to put country of origin stamp on your back deck

image.altText: Oscar Jenkins charged

props.synopsis: Russian authorities have laid criminal charges against Australian man Oscar Jenkins for being a "mercenary in an armed conflict", four months after the former teacher was captured while fighting for Ukrainian forces.

title.children: Captured Melbourne fighter Oscar Jenkins facing 15 years in Russian jail

image.altText: Damien Hardwick wearing a red Suns polo

props.synopsis: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick does not believe Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan should have commented on whether Richmond's Noah Balta should have been allowed to play while facing sentencing for assault.

title.children: 'Absolute mockery': Hardwick takes aim at Victorian premier over Balta comments

image.altText: Waves break close to a beach with bush on the edge of the cliffs.

props.synopsis: Organisers were hoping for better surfing conditions after competition was suspended after one heat in the men's opening round on Friday.

title.children: Surfing called off at Bells Beach due to unfavourable conditions

image.altText: Melbourne City players pour Gatorade on each other in celebration

props.synopsis: Melbourne City continues a 23-match unbeaten run with a 5-1 win over Perth Glory to seal a second consecutive A-League Women premiership.

title.children: Stunning free kick sees City complete unbeaten season to seal ALW premiership

image.altText: old woman in pink top with neutral expression standing on a school crossing

props.synopsis: The longtime primary school crossing guard wins an unfair dismissal case against a regional Victorian council that sacked her due to a disputed knee injury.

title.children: Council's sacking of 86yo lollipop lady found to be unfair

image.altText: Jacob cuddles a lamb in his arms

props.synopsis: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

title.children: They can't vote yet but these country kids want more from politicians

image.altText: woman sitting on couch sipping cup of coffee

props.synopsis: The Let Them Theory from motivational speaker and author Mel Robbins is about letting go of the need to control others and instead focusing on your reactions. We asked three psychologists what they make of it.

title.children: What psychologists think of the Let Them Theory

image.altText: Sam Draper leaves the field injured in Bombers vs Eagles AFL match.

props.synopsis: Sam Draper's Achilles injury means Essendon will have no choice but to turn to veteran big man Todd Goldstein, who has been working as a pseudo ruck coach for the club so far this year.

title.children: Bombers forced to rely on 'ruck coach' to play amid fresh injury carnage

image.altText: GettyImages-2210136442

props.synopsis: Tyler Wright posts the second-best wave score of the women's opening round at Bells Beach during the Rip Curl Pro.

title.children: Tyler Wright soaks up Bells Beach return as men's opening called off

image.altText: Two young men enjoying their vibrant urban oasis on a balcony in Brunswick.

props.synopsis: Take inspiration from two very different balcony gardens in Naarm/Melbourne that have been designed to feel like a garden on the ground.

title.children: How to make your balcony feel like a garden

image.altText: a lighthouse with large waves

props.synopsis: Authorities have urged people to exercise caution around the water during a warm Easter weekend, after multiple drownings across the east coast on Good Friday.

title.children: Four dead, two missing after Good Friday drownings at east coast beaches

image.altText: Two police officers stand on a street at night, near police and ambulance vehicles.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says two officers opened fire after a man armed with a knife charged at them in Melbourne's inner west on Thursday night.

title.children: Man armed with knife charged officers before fatal shots, police say

image.altText: A woman standing in a half finished room with doors yet to be installed behind her.

props.synopsis: Homeowners who say their complaints to the Victorian Building Authority failed to materially improve their situation, are now calling on the state government to provide compensation.

title.children: 'I can't get out': How Andrea's country home dream turned to nightmare

image.altText: A man on a horse carrying a whip tries to stop three other horses running away

props.synopsis: Rangers are scouring Victoria's high country for a horse that escaped handlers during a re-enactment of Banjo Patterson's Man From Snowy River poem.

title.children: Horse still missing a week after Man From Snowy River re-enactment goes awry

image.altText: A man in a blue suit stands outside a building.

props.synopsis: Ricky Nixon, a formerly powerful figure the AFL, is charged by police following social media posts which police allege were threatening.

title.children: Ex-AFL player agent Ricky Nixon charged over alleged death threat

image.altText: Monique Ryan leaving a press conference.

props.synopsis: Campaign tactics have again been put under the spotlight in the seat of Kooyong, after residents received calls and texts endorsing independent MP Monique Ryan.

title.children: Kooyong MP Monique Ryan says she is not aware of 'push polling'

image.altText: Heidi smiles while walking on sand at a beach.

props.synopsis: The parents of a three-year-old child who was killed when a car lost control in Victoria last week have paid tribute to their daughter and spoken of the "outpouring of love" they have received from the community.

title.children: Parents of 3yo Heidi remember 'beautiful' daughter killed in crash

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking out a window into a garden

props.synopsis: Victorian senate candidate Jordan van den Lamb says he will consider an apology to a Victorian woman whose vacant property was occupied by squatters after he published the address online.

title.children: 'I'm not rich': Break-in victim calls out senate candidate's squatting campaign
